intro: Heterosmilax gaudichaudiana var. hongkongensis, commonly known as Hong Kong arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Asia. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its underground stems, known as rhizomes, are the primary part used for culinary purposes. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
